chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew A. WRAY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Undergo a psycho-sexual evaluation if the agent deems it appropriate.

Undergo sex offender treatment.

Comply with sex offender registry.

No contact with the victim, the victim's family and siblings.

No contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent or unless supervised by an adult approved by DOC.

No possession or use of the internet or any internet enabled devices.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew A. WRAY

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 11-18-14 at 9:00 a.m.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-15-14 at 9:00 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-20-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with the victim, B.R.K., DOB: 05-22-2002, no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 and no internet usage.  Bail furnished.
